item.title: Xlstm
item.description: A couple of weeks ago, my Twitter feed was flooded with discussions about the new xLSTM paper. Curious, I took a quick look at it. Like most papers, it first presents a problem statement, highlights the challenges in solving that problem, and finally details the approach used to address—or not address—these challenges. The xLSTM paper did this well, but it also brought me back to some fundamental questions: How does the original LSTM solve the gradient explosion and vanishing gradient problems?
